Albany.Building at 44 Central Avenue:
44 Central Avenue (also known as J.R. Peter's and Sons) is a historic commercial building located at the address of the same name in the Washington Avenue neighborhood of Albany, Albany County, New York.


== Description and history ==
It was built sometime between June 23, 1813 and 1817 at a prominent intersection known as Robinson's Point, and is a three-story, load bearing brick wedge-shaped building with the bricks on the exterior laid in a Flemish bond pattern. It sits on an uncoarsed rubble foundation and has a full basement.
